poem:
Title: "Of Stolen Wheels and Silent Blue"

In the grey light of Essex, a motorcycle roars,
Piloted by undeserving hands, unchecked by laws.
Brian Johnson, unsung rider of his kin's lost cause,
Shadowed by the promise of "no tax" applause.
Night thief's echo unmet by the law's claws,
Leaves common heroes alone, in the chase's jaws.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK general election 2024 live: ‘No tax surprises’ in manifesto, Keir Starmer says 12.58pm BST The Labour leader and shadow home secretary spoke to victims of antisocial behaviour during a campaign stop in Essex. Brian Johnson, 56, told Sir Keir Starmer about the theft of his son’s motorcycle, with the suspects riding it up and down his street. However, police said there were no officers available to attend, so Johnson chased the suspects himself with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
